active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs of using JWTs versus session-based authentication in high-traffic APIs. Consider scalability, security risks (e.g., token theft), and alignment with Zero Trust. Support arguments with references to OWASP API Security Top 10 and NIST SP 800-228.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Secure API Development (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Information Systems Security Capabilities > Application Security > Secure Coding Practices > Secure API Development). Generate 50-75 high-quality flashcards using the exact schema: Each card is a JSON object with 'front' (MCQ question + 4 options A-D) and 'back' (correct_answer bolded, explanation, distractor_analysis, active_learning_tie_in optional, bloom_level, scaffold_layer). Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [paste full list above] - Active Learning: Tie in where relevant. - Scaffolding: Balance cards: 20% Layer 1, 25% Layer 2, 30% Layer 3, 25% Layer 4. - Research Context: API defs, auth/authz, cloud-native, API Gateway, Zero Trust, JWTs. NIST SP 800-228 (full: Framework for secure API design/implement/eval: threat modeling, patterns like mutual TLS, continuous monitoring). OWASP API Sec Top 10 (BOLA, auth broken, excessive data, etc.). Best practices: input val, error handling, rate limiting. Sources: NIST SP 800-228 (https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-228), OWASP API Top 10 (owasp.org/API-Security/), OAuth 2.0 RFC 6749. - Prior Knowledge: Link to HTTP/REST, basic auth. - Big Picture: Critical for Zero Trust/cloud apps. Distractors: Follow protocol exactly (plausible, semantic/reversal/unrelated). Explanations: 2-4 sentences, pedagogical, reference objectives/layers/sources. Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcards. Ensure variety, no duplicates, university-level rigor.
